sense.name: the process of decreasing in size or quantity
sense.commentary: SHRINKAGE[+process][+decreasing][+size] [+quantity][+amount][+loss][+resulting] Note: nominalization: the shrinkage of the fabric -> the fabric shrinks
sense.examples: Mary didn't allow for shrinkage of the fabric when she hemmed the curtains. Due to shrinkage of their funding, the institute had to cancel one of its conferences this year. The cookbook described the shrinkage of the souffle after it cooled. You can expect a quarter-inch shrinkage after you wash this shirt.

sense.name: loss of merchandise through theft
sense.commentary: SHRINKAGE[+activity][+theft][+merchandise] [+quantity][+amount][+merchandise][+shoplifted] Note: refers specifically to shoplifted merchandise
sense.examples: These losses are due to shrinkage. You have to factor in shrinkage when determining what your profits are. What is the inventory shrinkage in their business?
